Review Text: Entertaining, if not a bit contrived.  Like the actors and scripts, but it is contrived in that in NYC where there are scads of ADAs and hundreds of defense attorneys, these two end up facing each other every episode.  My biggest complaint right now is that Amazon removed this season from availability and we are not able to finish watching the remaining episodes.
Review Title: Good, but didn't get to finish
Rating: 4.0

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual exhibits a preference for well-acted, thought-provoking shows that lean towards quality storytelling and character-driven narratives. Consistently high ratings of 4.0 and above suggest a strong appreciation for engaging plots and notable casts, particularly in titles associated with reputable studios. A recurring theme is the enjoyment of shows that mix drama with intrigue, as evident in multiple reviews praising casts and storyline depth.

However, this consumer also displays a sensitivity to common industry tropes, such as excessive profanity, indicating a desire for smarter dialogue over shock value. This tension between appreciating mature themes and wanting elevated language signifies a nuanced palate. 

The purchaser shows an aversion to contrived narratives, preferring narratives that feel authentic and less formulaic, as indicated by mixed ratings for titles they found predictable. Pricing insight isn't explicitly mentioned, yet the habit of rating based on perceived value suggests a moderate price sensitivity; enjoyment of content appears paramount, outweighing potential cost factors. 

In summary, the core preferences highlight an affinity for quality television that offers depth and good writing while maintaining a standard against overly cliché or profane elements.

target_interaction.title: Enjoyable Tragedy
target_interaction.text: Convincing Anna!  Costumes and setting were authentic.  Well acted and true to the book.
